bill_title: revise the definition of fall enrollment for the purposes of education funding.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the definition of fall enrollment for the purposes of education funding. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That subdivision (2A) of § 13-13-10.1 be amended to read: (2A) "Fall enrollment," is calculated as follows: (a) Determine the number of kindergarten through twelfth grade students enrolled in all schools operated by the school district on the last Friday of September of the current school year; (b) Subtract the number of students for whom the district receives tuition except for: (i) Nonresident students who are in the care and custody of a state agency and are attending a public school district; (ii) Students who are being provided an education pursuant to § 13-28-11; and (iii) Students for whom tuition is being paid pursuant to § 13-28-42.1; and (c) Add the number of students for whom the district pays tuition. When computing state aid to education for a school district pursuant to § 13-13-73, the secretary of the Department of Education shall use either the school district's fall enrollment or the average of the school district's fall enrollment from the previous two years, whichever is greater;
